comments:
[Reported against M2 version]

Before you think "Hey this is probably a problem with the Sysdeo Tomcat plugin", 
please bear in mind that I have already reported another Preferences corruption 
bug in Bug# 40881.

Eclipse crashed with the (soon to be) attached error log.  Reopening of Eclipse 
I find that I cannot edit the Tomcat plugins Preferences, in particular the JVM 
settings preferences tree node, I receive the error:

"The current displayed page contains invalid values".

After hunting around a bit in the .metadata directory, I found in the '.log' 
file the following error trace (will attach full .log file as attachment too):

!SESSION Aug 14, 2003 08:08:46.830 ---------------------------------------------

java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.

/usr/local/eclipse/
!ENTRY org.eclipse.jface 4 2 Aug 14, 2003 08:08:46.832
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.jface".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
org/eclipse/debug/internal/ui/preferences/ComboFieldEditor
        at com.sysdeo.eclipse.tomcat.TomcatJVMPreferencePage.
createContents(TomcatJVMPreferencePage.java:78)
        at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferencePage.

showPage(PreferenceDialog.java:985)
        at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog$9.run(PreferenceDialog.
java:463)
        at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:84)
        at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog$8.
widgetSelected(PreferenceDialog.java:457)
        at org.eclipse.jface.util.OpenStrategy.
firePostSelectionEvent(OpenStrategy.java:198)
        at org.eclipse.jface.util.OpenStrategy.access$4(OpenStrategy.java:193)
        at org.eclipse.jface.util.OpenStrategy$3.run(OpenStrategy.java:333)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.
java:102)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:1810)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1626)

        at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:563)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.OpenPreferencesAction.

        at org.eclipse.jface.action.Action.runWithEvent(Action.java:842)
        at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.

        at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.

        at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem$6.
handleEvent(ActionContributionItem.java:468)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:82)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:943)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:1833)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1623)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1680)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1663)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.
run(InternalBootLoader.java:858)

Things I have tried to resolve this issue but with no success:

* renamed the './metatdata/.plugins/com.sysdeo.eclipse.tomcat/prefs*.ini file 
which seems different from a co-developers, hoping it would rebuild itself.

* Tried copying my co-developers prefs*.ini file

* removed the .metatdata/.cache* file

All have been no success.  Given the only way I was able to resolve the symptoms 
of Bug# 40881, I am thinking of trashing .metadata directory first and seeing 
what happens, otherwise it's a reinstall of Eclipse 3.0 M2 again.... :(

Any thoughts?

Created an attachment (id=5752)
Error that caused original crash

Created an attachment (id=5753)
the '.log' file I found in the .metatdata directory

I've gzipped this file as it's a a little large, but useful info I think.

Also tried completely removing the .metadata directory, on reopening Eclipse, it 
has reset itself to original preferences, yet this preferences error is still 
coming up, and the .metatdata/.log file contains the same "NoClassDefFound" 
issue.

Sorry, but this *is* a problem with the Sysdeo Tomcat Plugin.

Their preference page code relies on an internal class
(org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.preferences.ComboFieldEditor) from the
org.eclipse.debug.ui plugin, and they are not supposed to do that.

That class existed in Eclipse 2.1, but it does not exist anymore, what breaks
the Sysdeo Tomcat plugin. Maybe they have a newer version that s compatible with
Eclipse 3.0. Otherwise, you will have to use Eclipse 2.1 to use this plug-in.
*** Bug 42361 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
